page.title: 15GREENS FARM & ROLLS FARM
page.content: S.W. corner:{500070}.GREENS FARM:{ {505073}is an exeption in the area in that it has a substantial milking herd of Freisian cattle. The effect of this on land cover is a far greater proportion of cultivated grass & wheat & oil-seed rape account for only one half of this square kilometre. THE GREEN MAN:{509074} is a popular inn in the area. Adjacent to it is a small field used from time to time for 'car boot sales':for a small fixed charge,say five pounds or so, any unwanted articles may be sold from the boot of a car. The site owner usually arranges the advertising and sometimes such sales are held in support of a charity.ROLLS FARM:{500070}.One more example of a moated farm,now where the farmhouse remains as a period piece whilst the outbuildings & field patterns have been transformed.
